description: From ant- +‎ helminth +‎ -ic; the th in helminth has become t by dissimilation.

adjectives.description: anthelmintic (comparative more anthelmintic, superlative most anthelmintic)

examples: Research is progressing well on finding native plants with anthelmintic properties.

entries.meaning: (medicine) A drug for the treatment of intestinal worm infestation, either by killing the worms or by causing them to be expelled from the body.
examples: The bark of the root is likewise valued as an anthelmintic in cases of tape-worm.
